events.title: Trump supporters hail US strikes in Nigeria as ‘amazing Christmas present’
events.description: Some even celebrated ‘mass killing’ and the president’s ‘resolve’ in attacking Islamic State targets The US’s Christmas Day strikes against Islamic State targets in Nigeria have been met with praise by Donald Trump supporters who for months had been agitating for the president to respond forcefully to the killings of Christians in the country. “I can’t think of a better way to celebrate Christmas than by avenging the death of Christians through the justified mass killing of Islamic terrorists,” the far-right political activist Laura Loomer posted on X. “You’ve got to love it! Death to all Islamic terrorists! Thank you.” Continue reading...

events.title: Israel FM accuses Palestinian Authority of aiding terror with ‘Pay-for-Slay’ after deadly attack
events.description: Two Israelis were killed in terrorist attacks in Israel on Friday, as officials accused the Palestinian Authority of misleading the world about its active terror payment policy.

events.title: Australian prime minister announces national bravery honors after antisemitic terror attack
events.description: Australia announced a national bravery award for heroes who confronted ISIS-inspired gunmen during a deadly Hanukkah attack that killed 15 people in Sydney.

events.title: Homes threatened as bushfire rages south-east of Perth and storms hit Queensland and Northern Territory
events.description: Bushfire that is believed to have started at Boddington goldmine still uncontained, while monsoon trough soaks north-eastern Australia Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australians on both sides of the country have been warned to remain vigilant as floods and fires threatened their homes on Boxing Day. A bushfire continued to rage about 200km south-east of Perth on Friday morning, although nearby residents were no longer being urged to leave their homes. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump launches Christmas night airstrikes on ISIS 'Terrorist Scum' in Nigeria after killings of Christians
events.description: Trump said the United States launched Christmas night airstrikes in Nigeria targeting ISIS militants he accused of killing Christians in recent attacks.

events.title: Sudan civil war: Health system ‘on the verge of collapse’
events.description: The war in Sudan has been tearing the country apart for almost 1,000 days, putting the country’s health system under intolerable pressure. The World Health Organization (WHO) is reporting widespread disease outbreaks, severe shortages, malnutrition and rising deaths.

events.title: Syria: Guterres deplores deadly mosque blast in Homs
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres “unequivocally condemns” the deadly terrorist attack on a mosque in Homs, Syria during Friday prayers, his spokesperson said in a statement

events.title: Deadly blast hits Alawite mosque in Syria's Homs
events.description: At least eight people were killed and 18 wounded in a blast that struck a mosque in an Alawite neighbourhood of Homs province in Syria on Friday (December 26), state media reported. An Islamist militant group claimed responsibility for the attack.

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree ‘immediate’ ceasefire after weeks of deadly border clashes
events.description: Two countries pledge in joint statement to halt all forms of attacks and further troop deployments in long-running dispute over contested territory Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to an “immediate” ceasefire, pledging to end weeks of deadly border clashes that have killed more than 100 people and displaced more than half a million on both sides. In a joint statement, the two south-east Asian neighbours said the ceasefire would take effect on Saturday at noon local time and involve “all types of weapons, including attacks on civilians, civilian objects and infrastructures, and military objectives of either side, in all cases and all areas”. Continue reading...

events.title: Mosque bombing in Syria leaves 6 dead and 21 wounded
events.description: A bombing at a mosque in Homs, Syria, during Friday prayers has killed at least eight people and wounded 18 others

events.title: Sri Lanka cyclone: More than a million still need aid weeks after Ditwah floods
events.description: Nearly a month after Cyclone Ditwah tore across Sri Lanka, more than a million people – including over half a million children – remain in urgent need of humanitarian assistance, as floods, landslides and renewed rainfall continue to compound one of the country’s worst disasters in decades.

events.title: How C-drama streams from China hooked millions worldwide
events.description: The popularity of Chinese dramas is exploding, creating a multibillion-dollar industry. Global viewers find themselves attracted to these "universal" stories and appreciate their glimpse at Chinese culture.

events.title: Hundreds mourn in Syria's Homs after deadly mosque bombing
events.description: Hundreds of mourners have gathered outside a mosque in Homs, Syria, after a bombing killed eight people and wounded 18

events.title: Cambodia accuses Thailand of launching strikes during border peace talks
events.description: Thai reports claim Cambodia carried out overnight attacks ahead of officials from both countries meeting for a third day of negotiations on Friday Cambodia has accused Thailand of intensifying its bombardment of disputed border areas, even as officials from the two countries attend a multi-day meeting aimed at negotiating an end to deadly clashes. The neighbours’ longstanding border conflict reignited this month , shattering an earlier truce and killing more than 40 people, according to official counts. About a million people have also been displaced. Continue reading...

events.title: Victoria police name man they want to interview in relation to ‘Happy Chanukah’ car fire in St Kilda
events.description: Police say there is no indication John Argento, 47, poses specific risk to the Jewish community, but believe he may be able to help with investigation Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Victoria police have named a man they want to interview in relation to a suspected arson attack on a car sporting a “Happy Chanukah” sign in Melbourne on Christmas Day. Police said emergency services were called to a vehicle displaying a mobile billboard that had been set alight in the driveway of a property in St Kilda East about 2.50am on Thursday. Continue reading...

events.title: Top 10 natural disasters cost more than $120 billion in 2025, Christian Aid report says
events.description: A report out Saturday (December 27) has sought to catalogue some of the most significant extreme weather events of the year. UK charity Christian aid found that heatwaves are pushing the limits of human adaptation, hurricanes and typhoons are breaking records and extreme rainfall, and droughts are devastating lives and livelihoods across the globe. It's all coming at a heavy financial cost.

events.title: This 56-year conflict still pauses for Christmas
events.description: At Christmas, the world can seem a little more humane than usual - even in wartime.

events.title: Pope Leo XIV delivers first Christmas message calling for end to violence in Middle East, Russia-Ukraine war
events.description: Pope Leo XIV delivers Christmas message calling for peace in Middle East and Ukraine, urging world leaders to reject violence and embrace dialogue.

events.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
events.description: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’ Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago. The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘They’re scared of us now’: how co-investment in a tropical forest saw off loggers
events.description: Low-cost tech and joined-up funding have reduced illegal logging, mining and poaching in the Darién Gap – it’s a success story that could stop deforestation worldwide There are no roads through the Darién Gap. This vast impenetrable forest spans the width of the land bridge between South and Central America, but there is almost no way through it: hundreds have lost their lives trying to cross it on foot. Its size and hostility have shielded it from development for millennia, protecting hundreds of species – from harpy eagles and giant anteaters to jaguars and red-crested tamarins – in one of the most biodiverse places on Earth. But it has also made it incredibly difficult to protect. Looking after 575,000 hectares (1,420,856 acres) of beach, mangrove and rainforest with just 20 rangers often felt impossible, says Segundo Sugasti, the director of Darién national park. Like tropical forests all over the world, it has been steadily shrinking, with at least 15% lost to logging, mining and cattle ranching in two decades. Continue reading...

events.title: Yemen: 'The status quo is no longer feasible', analyst says
events.description: Saudi Arabia warned Saturday (December 27) it would back Yemen's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces and urged them to withdraw "peacefully" from recently-seized provinces. The statements came a day after reported Saudi air strikes on separatist positions in Yemen's Hadramawt province. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Liza Kaminov is joined by Mohammed Al-Basha, Founder of Basha Report, a US-based risk advisory firm.

events.title: Somalia denounces Israeli recognition of Somaliland
events.description: Somalia reacted angrily Friday (December 26) after Israel formally recognised the northern region of Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state" – the first country to do so. Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991, has for decades pushed for international recognition. US President Donald Trump said he opposed US recognition of Somaliland in an interview with the New York Post.

events.title: UN peacekeeper injured in gunfire near ‘Blue Line’ in south Lebanon
events.description: One United Nations peacekeeper was injured on Friday after heavy machine gunfire from Israel Defense Forces (IDF) positions south of the Blue Line, following a nearby grenade explosion, impacted close to a UN patrol in southern Lebanon.

events.title: Historic vote looms in Central African Republic as UN urges peaceful participation
events.description: With Central Africans set to vote in presidential, legislative, regional and long-delayed municipal elections this weekend, the United Nations has appealed for calm and restraint, warning that the credibility of the process will be critical to consolidating peace after years of conflict and instability.

events.title: Blast at Syrian mosque during Friday prayers leaves at least eight dead
events.description: The explosion in Homs targeted a predominantly Alawite area, a sect that has faced crackdowns and violence since the fall of former-President Bashar al-Assad.

events.title: Sky News correspondents look back at 2025
events.description: It has been a turbulent year. Wars have erupted or dragged on, international crises have deepened - but there have been bright spots too.

events.title: Millions of Afghans face hunger as aid cuts deepen a humanitarian crisis
events.description: Millions of Afghans are struggling as international aid cuts sever a lifeline many relied on for food and heating

events.title: Italian authorities arrest 9 people who allegedly used charities to funnel more than $8m to Hamas
events.description: Italy arrested nine people linked to three charities that allegedly funneled approximately $8.2 million to the Hamas terrorist organization.

events.title: Russia pummels Kyiv ahead of Zelensky-Trump meeting
events.description: Russia pummelled Ukraine's capital with drones and missiles on Saturday, killing a woman and cutting power to hundreds of thousands, ahead of President Volodymyr Zelensky's latest talks with US leader Donald Trump. Zelensky said Russia’s attack on Ukraine shows that Russia does “not want to end the war”. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert gives us his analysis.

events.title: How climate change is threatening human rights
events.description: With rising effects of climate change across the globe, the world has started recognising that climate change is not just an ecological collapse, but also a human rights crisis.

events.title: Industrialisation without destruction: A UN blueprint for the future
events.description: Since the 19th century, industrialisation has had a transformative effect on the world, both positive and negative. It has created jobs and lifted millions out of poverty. But it has also had devastating consequences; destroying ecosystems, polluting the air, and driving the climate crisis that threatens to make large parts of the planet uninhabitable.

events.title: Repeat offender freed after SWAT standoff tied to three shootings in one month: report
events.description: Texas repeat offender allegedly linked to three separate shootings in one month, including random drive-by attacks and SWAT standoff in Hays County area.

events.title: Syria: At least 8 killed in first major mosque attack since Assad
events.description: A deadly blast tore through an Alawite mosque during Friday prayers in the western city of Homs. A little-known militant group has claimed responsibility as Syria's sectarian tensions erupt again.

events.title: A massive crash on a highway in Japan kills 1 person and injures 26 as the holiday season starts
events.description: A massive crash in snowy weather has killed one person and injured 26 on an expressway in Japan

events.title: UN renews ceasefire push in Sudan
events.description: The UN has urged Sudan’s warring parties to pursue compromise and an immediate ceasefire, even as drone attacks, displacement and the killing of peacekeepers underscore the growing risks to civilians and humanitarians.

events.title: Overnight strikes leave death, destruction and power outages in Ukraine
events.description: A new wave of overnight strikes and front-line hostilities in Ukraine have caused further civilian casualties and damage to critical energy infrastructure, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Myanmar elections marked by fear as UN warns civilians are coerced from all sides
events.description: As Myanmar approaches elections scheduled for 28 December, the UN’s top human rights official has said that civilians are being coerced from all sides – forced by the military to vote and threatened by armed opposition groups to boycott – in a climate of fear, violence and mass repression.

events.title: UPS plane crash in Louisville claims 15th victim weeks after fiery takeoff failure
events.description: The death toll from a UPS cargo plane crash in Louisville, Kentucky, has risen to 15 after a man injured in the incident died weeks later on Christmas Day, officials said.

events.title: Trump’s peace through strength in 2025: where wars stopped and rivals came to the table
events.description: Trump's 2025 peace agenda produced mostly positive results with new ceasefires in Gaza and other regions, but major conflicts like Ukraine remain unresolved.

events.title: At least 15 dead, 19 injured in Guatemala as bus plunges into ravine
events.description: The bus, which was travelling between Guatemala City and San Marcos, crashed for unknown reasons, authorities say.

events.title: ‘It’s the wildest place I have walked’: new national park will join up Chile’s 2,800km wildlife corridor
events.description: Government poised to officially protect 200,000 hectares of remote Patagonian coastline and forest Chile’s government is poised to create the country’s 47th national park, protecting nearly 200,000 hectares (500,000 acres) of pristine wilderness and completing a wildlife corridor stretching 1,700 miles (2,800km) to the southernmost tip of the Americas. The Cape Froward national park is a wild expanse of wind-torn coastline and forested valleys that harbours unrivalled biodiversity and has played host to millennia of human history. Continue reading...

events.title: Saudi Arabia backs Yemen's government, urges separatists to withdraw from seized provinces
events.description: Saudi Arabia on Saturday said it would back Sanaa's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces in a statement that came a day after reported Saudi air strikes in Yemen's Hadramawt province.The Southern Transition Council (STC) separatists backed by the United Arab Emirates have recently made territorial gains, embarrassing regional heavyweight Saudi Arabia.

events.title: Security Council remains divided over Iran nuclear programme, sanctions stay in place
events.description: At a meeting to discuss nuclear non-proliferation on Tuesday, the Security Council’s stance on Iran’s nuclear activities remained divided on the issue, split between those who support the reinstatement of sanctions, and the members who believe the sanctions should be permanently lifted, whilst questioning the legality of the meeting itself.

events.title: LIVE: Security Council meets on Venezuela, Iran, Somalia
events.description: The Security Council convened earlier today for a packed agenda, adopting a resolution extending the authorisation of the African Union support mission in Somalia (AUSSOM) and hearing a briefing on Iran and the implementation of resolution 2231, which endorsed the 2015 nuclear deal known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA). Members are set to reconvene at 3 pm for an emergency meeting requested by Venezuela, amid heightened tensions between Caracas and Washington. Assistant Secretary-General for Political Affairs Khaled Khiari is expected to brief ambassadors. Follow live below and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: WA bushfire downgraded while Queensland and NT brace for monsoonal rain and flooding
events.description: Conditions ease south-west of Perth as residents evacuated from Boddington fire on Christmas Day allowed to return Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australia is bracing for two extremes over the next week, with parts of the west facing days of extreme fire danger and a cyclone and flood watch issued for parts of Queensland and the Northern Territory. Residents who evacuated their homes ahead of an out-of-control bushfire near Boddington, 130km south-east of Perth, were able to return home on Saturday, Western Australian fire authorities said. Continue reading...

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire
events.description: Thailand and Cambodia agreed to an "immediate" ceasefire on Saturday (December 26), the two countries said in a joint statement, pledging to end border clashes that killed dozens of people.

events.title: UN Security Council hears warnings over escalating US-Venezuela standoff
events.description: Tensions between the United States and Venezuela have sharply escalated amid increased US military operations in the Southern Caribbean, prompting accusations of sovereignty violations, concerns over civilian harm and growing calls at the UN Security Council for restraint and de-escalation.

events.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine, ahead of Trump meeting, is 'willing to do whatever it takes' to end war with Russia
events.description: Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv reportedly kills one, injures 27 as Ukraine's president prepares for crucial Trump meeting with peace proposal.

events.title: 7.0-magnitude earthquake rattles Taiwan
events.description: The quake struck off Taiwan's northeastern coast, and shook buildings in the capital, Taipei.

events.title: Two killed in suspected Palestinian ramming and knife attack in Israel
events.description: Police say the attacker, from the occupied West Bank, ran over at least one person before stabbing another victim several miles away.

events.title: Nigeria provided US with intelligence for strikes on Islamist militants, says foreign minister – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed. US warns of more Nigeria strikes Explained: Why has Trump ordered strikes in Nigeria? Here are some images of the aftermath of US strikes in Nigeria that have come via the news wires today: Nigerians across Sokoto state told of their shock at Christmas Day strikes by the United States. Continue reading...

events.title: Russian drones, missiles pound Ukraine ahead of Zelensky's US visit
events.description: Russia attacked Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine with missiles and drones on Saturday (December 27), ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelensky said ⁠would be a crucial meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump to work out a plan to end nearly four years of war.

events.title: Fifteen injured in knife and chemical attack at tyre factory in Japan
events.description: Fifteen people have been injured after a knife and chemical attack at a tyre factory in Japan.

events.title: At least 15 injured in a knife and chemical attack at a factory in Japan
events.description: A man has been arrested after stabbing eight people and injuring seven others with a chemical believed to be bleach at a rubber factory in central Japan

events.title: Crime lords turn Motor City into car-theft supermarket for Middle East buyers: ‘Somebody's getting paid’
events.description: International organized crime groups are recruiting juveniles to steal vehicles in Detroit before shipping them to the Middle East, alarming law enforcement officials.

events.title: Late-night joyride ends in disaster as driver smashes into towering Christmas tree on camera
events.description: Wild CCTV footage captures driver's joyride gone wrong as car crashes into Christmas tree in Kazakhstan square, toppling holiday display before fleeing.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Venezuela says it released 99 people detained for 2024 election protests
events.description: Government said the move was due to its ‘unrestricted respect for human rights’ in the face of US aggression Venezuela has said it has carried out its largest release of political prisoners this year, claiming to have freed 99 people detained for taking part in protests after the 2024 election, widely believed to have been stolen by the dictator Nicolás Maduro , as it comes under increasing military pressure from the US. Civil society organisations have treated the news with caution and stressed that the releases were insufficient, noting that at least 900 political prisoners remain in the country. Continue reading...

events.title: Call for citizen scientists to monitor threatened turtle species on NSW beaches
events.description: Beachgoers from the Tweed to Batemans Bay have been asked to be on the lookout – and every nest reported to TurtleWatch NSW will be protected Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The first sea turtle nest discovery of the breeding season has led to a rescue mission and kicked off a campaign to protect an endangered species. The nest, found recently on the New South Wales north coast, was too close to the water’s edge and the eggs needed to be moved to save them from being inundated by waves and the tides. Continue reading...

events.title: Russia attacks Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-US talks
events.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.

events.title: Israel becomes first nation to recognize Somaliland
events.description: Israel has become the world's first country to recognize Somaliland, which proclaimed independence from Somalia in 1991, as a sovereign nation.

events.title: Russia attacks Kyiv ahead of Ukraine-US talks
events.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning (December 27), a day before talks between Ukraine and the US, local authorities said.

events.title: 'We won't stop': How Gen Z’s anger became a global movement in 2025
events.description: From Kathmandu to Lima, Generation Z took to the streets in 2025 to denounce inequality, corruption and political exclusion. Across the Global South, young people turned scattered local protests into a shared moment of mobilisation. FRANCE 24 looks back on a pivotal year for a generational movement set to remain in the spotlight in 2026.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Morocco forced to wait for knockout place after Mali draw
events.description: Morocco were unable to guarantee their spot in the Africa Cup of Nations on Friday after a 1-1 draw with Mali. The stalemate in the capital Rabat ended Morocco's world record-winning run of 19 matches.

events.title: Thousands without power in Kyiv after massive Russian attack
events.description: Authorities say a third of residents in the Ukrainian capital have been left without heating in freezing weather.

events.title: Myanmar is set to hold phased elections. Here's why they're being called a 'sham'
events.description: Myanmar's military rulers are holding a general election in phases starting Dec. 28 amid the country's civil war. The head of the U.N. says the vote will be anything but free and fair.

events.title: Guatemala: At least 15 killed after bus plunges into ravine
events.description: A passenger bus plunged into a ravine on the Inter-American Highway in western Guatemala, killing at least 15 people.

events.title: France: 3 women stabbed in Paris metro, suspect arrested
events.description: A man in his 20s is suspected to have attacked three women in different locations in the French capital's Metro.

events.title: US air strikes in Nigeria targeted IS group fighters trying to enter from Sahel, govt says
events.description: US-backed air strikes in Nigeria targeted Islamic State group fighters who were attempting to enter the country from the Sahel region, according to the Nigerian government. US President Donald Trump said on his social media platform that the strikes were carried out on Thursday at the request of Nigeria's government, and that the group had been targeting Christians in the region.

events.title: Yemeni separatists accuse Saudi Arabia of air strikes in eastern provinces
events.description: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council (STC) separatists on Friday (December 26) accused Saudi Arabia of carrying out air strikes on their positions in the east of the country, a claim Riyadh has not acknowledged.

events.title: Pakistan summons UK diplomat over a threat to army chief during a rally
events.description: Pakistan has summoned Britain’s deputy high commissioner after a viral video showed a woman at a rally in the city of Bradford saying the Pakistani army chief would die in a possible attack

events.title: Russia attacks Kyiv with missiles and drones, wounding 11 ahead of Ukraine-US meeting
events.description: Russia has attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones, wounding at least 11 people

events.title: World News in Brief: Gaza aid restrictions, Syria humanitarian needs, lawyer reprisals in Burundi
events.description: The UN and partners continue to provide assistance to people in Gaza, where recent winter storms have worsened conditions for thousands across the enclave.

events.title: Two dead in 50-vehicle pile up on Japan highway
events.description: A further 26 people are injured in the crash on a highway in central Japan, police say.

events.title: Libya holds funeral for military officials killed in Turkiye crash
events.description: Military funeral held for senior military officers, including army chief of staff Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad.

events.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal
events.description: New conviction over plunder of state fund substantially increases six-year term in separate case The jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak has been sentenced to an additional 15 years after he was found guilty of abuse of power, in the biggest trial yet in the multibillion-dollar fraud scandal related to the state fund 1MDB. Najib’s conviction substantially increases the six-year prison term he is already serving for a separate case related to the 1MDB graft scandal, one of the world’s biggest financial frauds in which billions were plundered from the now defunct sovereign wealth fund. Continue reading...

events.title: Peak Oil: Why the world can't break its fossil fuel habit
events.description: Climate change shifted the oil production debate from scarcity to demand. If countries do not deliver on ambitious green pledges, one expert predicts that production may peak within two years, forcing a chaotic decline.

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire agreement after weeks of deadly border clashes
events.description: Thailand and Cambodia on Saturday (December 27) signed a ceasefire agreement after three weeks of fighting that killed at least 47 people and displaced more than a million. FRANCE 24 correspondent, Tommy Walker, tells us more.

events.title: Turkey holds military funeral for Libyan officers killed in plane crash
events.description: Turkey has held a military funeral for five Libyan officers who died in a plane crash earlier this week

events.title: Nebraska grandfather killed in 'freak accident' at McDonald’s drive-thru
events.description: A grandfather died days before Christmas in a "freak accident" at a Nebraska drive-thru after being pinned between his car and the payment window.

events.title: Christmas spirit returns to Jesus' birthplace after more than two years of war
events.description: Thousands celebrate Christmas in Bethlehem for the first time since the implementation of the U.S.-brokered Israel-Hamas ceasefire agreement.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: M 6.0 - 2025 Taitung, Taiwan Earthquake
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - VII DYFI? - VI Time 2025-12-24 09:47:06 UTC 2025-12-24 09:47:06 UTC at epicenter Location 22.851°N 121.207°E Depth 10.00 km (6.21 mi)

events.title: The latest on the nuclear sub deal between the U.S. and South Korea
events.description: The U.S. will shift some of the burden of defense to its allies, and it will equip them for it. One ally's equipment: nuclear submarines for South Korea.

events.title: Munich surfers abandon attempt to restart Eisbach wave
events.description: City authorities are putting up unnecessary resistance to restoring the world-famous surf spot, the local sports association said.

events.title: Saudi-led coalition in Yemen warns UAE-backed separatists of immediate action
events.description: The Saudi-led coalition in Yemen has warned it will respond immediately to any military movements of separatists backed by the United Arab Emirates that undermine de-escalation efforts in the south, as the United States urged diplomacy

events.title: Turkish authorities say arrested suspected IS member was planning New Year's attacks
events.description: Turkish authorities have apprehended a suspected member of the extremist Islamic State group planning attacks on New Year's celebrations

events.title: Grand jury declines to indict man in deadly Kentucky State University shooting
events.description: A grand jury refused to indict a father of two Kentucky State University students who shot two people who were beating his son's head against the pavement.

events.title: North Korea releases images of development of nuclear-powered submarine
events.description: New photos show North Korea's apparent progress in the development of a nuclear-powered submarine as Kim Jong Un condemns South Korea's efforts.

events.title: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
events.description: Trump tells Politico he ordered the strikes as "a Christmas present" - contradicting a statement by Nigerian officials.

events.title: Trump's claim US airstrikes in Nigeria hit ISIS targets 'sketchy', presidential adviser tells Sky News
events.description: A special adviser to the Nigerian president has told Sky News details about who the US hit in Christmas Day strikes in the country were "sketchy" - despite Donald Trump's claims.

events.title: Times Square ball goes red, white and blue for America's 250th birthday
events.description: Times Square's 2025 ball drop will sparkle in red, white and blue patriotic colors to kick off America's 250th birthday celebrations nationwide this year.

events.title: Brown, MIT shootings may have stemmed from suspect’s failures, fixation on scientist’s success: report
events.description: Portuguese official reveals suspected shooter allegedly fixated on MIT scientist as symbol of success he never achieved in tragic academic obsession case.

events.title: Fox News ‘Antisemitism Exposed’ Newsletter: UN bigot out at Georgetown
events.description: Fox News' "Antisemitism Exposed" newsletter brings you stories on the rising anti-Jewish prejudice across the U.S. and the world.

events.title: Ex-Malaysia PM Najib Razak given 15-year jail term over state funds scandal
events.description: Najib was convicted for his role in the billion-dollar scandal involving the country's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

events.title: Waterskiing Santas and giant cuts of meat: Christmas around the world
events.description: From London to Bethlehem, services and festivities to mark the holiday cheer are in full swing.

events.title: Investigation after jet carrying Libyan officers crashes in Turkiye
events.description: Authorities are examining a wide range of data, including flight recordings and airpot CCTV footage, officials say.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: What happened to U.S. foreign aid this year?
events.description: Historically, the U.S. had been the top donor for global health. That changed dramatically this year. We look at the new approach the U.S. is pursuing and what this has meant for people on the ground.

events.title: Germany at the 2026 World Cup: What next?
events.description: Now that they have qualified and drawn in group E, Germany head into the final part of their 2026 World Cup preparations. Here's what to know.

events.title: Israel: Palestinian held over deadly car‑ramming, stabbing
events.description: Israel has launched a milltary operation in the alleged attacker’s West Bank hometown following a deadly series of assaults in northern Israel.

events.title: Nigerian villagers are rattled by US airstrikes that made their homes shake and the sky glow red
events.description: A U.S. airstrike that targeted an alleged Islamic State camp in Nigeria has caused panic in the village of Jabo

events.title: First Person: Felipe Paullier, the youngest ever senior UN official, charged with giving a voice to young people around the world
events.description: A paediatrician by training, Felipe Paullier has long been an advocate for youth. Formerly Director of the Uruguayan Government's Youth Institute, a role which involved several joint actions with various UN agencies, he was appointed to run the UN Youth Office in 2023, the youngest senior appointment in United Nations history.

events.title: Paper and wood: Forest products show signs of recovery, UN agency says
events.description: From wood-based panels used in construction, to charcoal for cooking food, forest products are valued and traded all around the world.

events.title: Four hikers found dead after avalanche in central Greece
events.description: A search operation was launched after three men and a woman went missing on Christmas Day.

events.title: Analysis: ISIL attacks could undermine US-Syria security collaboration
events.description: ISIL attacks dropped after Assad regime fell. But the group is likely attempting to destabilise Syria's new government.

events.title: What drove conflict in 2025, and who was behind it?
events.description: From Ukraine to Palestine to Sudan, millions were exposed to conflict in 2025

events.title: Russia using Belarus territory to bypass Ukraine’s defences, says Zelenskyy
events.description: Ukrainian leader accuses Belarus of helping Russian forces to circumvent defences that protect Ukraine from attack.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Weather tracker: Deep freeze grips Canada as US records warmest Christmas
events.description: Temperatures plunge below -50C in the Yukon, while swaths of US experience springlike weather Northern Canada has been gripped by an intense and prolonged cold spell, with temperatures hovering between -20C and -40C for weeks. On Tuesday, Braeburn in the Yukon recorded -55.7C, its coldest December temperature since 1975. Meanwhile, Mayo and Dawson endured 16 consecutive nights below -40C, with Mayo plunging to -50.4C on Monday. Whitehorse also recorded 10 nights when temperatures dropped below -30C. Continue reading...

events.title: Paddle boarders rescued after being swept more than 10km across Port Phillip Bay in three-hour ordeal
events.description: Pair say they were ‘exhausted, very shaken and feel so lucky’ after being spotted by air wing officers late on Christmas Day Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Two paddle boarders who were rescued after being swept more than 10km across Victoria’s Port Phillip Bay on Christmas Day say they are exhausted and shaken but grateful to have survived. Victoria police said the pair set out from Portarlington on the Bellarine peninsula about 3pm on Thursday but drifted out into the bay when conditions deteriorated and were swept all the way to Wyndham harbour in Melbourne’s outer west. Continue reading...

events.title: U.S. strikes alleged Islamic State camps in Nigeria
events.description: President Trump ordered U.S. strikes on ISIS targets in northwest Nigeria, in response to what he claimed is persecution of Christians

events.title: U.S. strikes ISIS in Nigeria. And, holiday shopping was higher than expected
events.description: The U.S. has launched a "deadly strike" against Islamic State fighters in northwest Nigeria, according to Trump. And, holiday spending was higher than expected this year.

events.title: What to know about the militants targeted by US airstrikes in northwest Nigeria
events.description: The United States airstrikes targeting militants affiliated with the Islamic State in northwestern Nigeria are a major escalation of an offensive that Nigeria’s overstretched military has struggled with for years

events.title: California family revives beloved Christmas tradition with surprise sleepover visit
events.description: A California family surprised grandparents with a heartwarming Christmas sleepover at home, reviving a 25-year tradition in a viral video.

events.title: Stabbing spree, chemical attack at Japan factory injures 15
events.description: A 38-year-old male suspect is in custody following an alleged stabbing spree and chemical attack at a Yokohama Rubber Co. tire factory in central Japan.

events.title: Video: Nigerians in village bombed by US describe what happened
events.description: 'Debris was burning’. Nigerians have described what they witnessed in US strikes on the town of Jabo.

events.title: UK youth to be offered military ‘gap year’ in bid to boost defence: Report
events.description: UK plans to boost ranks of armed forces by offering young people paid military experience amid growing Russian threats.

events.title: Man reveals what it's like celebrating Christmas in country where it's banned
events.description: When Il-yong Ju was a child, something strange would happen in his tiny village in rural North Korea every 25 December.

events.title: Ukraine, US near 20-point peace deal as Putin spurns Zelenskyy Christmas ceasefire offer
events.description: Ukraine and U.S. near finalizing 20-point security framework as Zelenskyy reports 90% agreement on guarantees while Russia pushback signals changes needed.

events.title: Should a top Russian archaeologist face trial for digging in occupied Crimea?
events.description: The case of a scholar wanted in Ukraine sparked a debate on the relationship between museums and the Russian state.

events.description: Zelenskyy accuses Russia's leadership of using 'every opportunity' to inflict 'greater suffering' on Ukraine.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Trump-backed candidate Asfura declared new president of Honduras
events.description: Winning margin of 28,000 votes announced a month late but before review of all ‘inconsistent’ ballots was completed Donald Trump-backed candidate Nasry “Tito” Asfura has been declared the winner of Honduras’s presidential election after a vote count that dragged on for almost a month and was marred by fraud allegations and criticism of interference by the US president . The rightwing Asfura, 67, a construction magnate and former mayor of the capital, Tegucigalpa, secured 40.27% of the vote, against 39.53% for the centre-right Salvador Nasralla, a margin of just 28,000 votes. Continue reading...

events.title: Cote d'Ivoire election held amid opposition boycott
events.description: Polls have opened for parliamentary elections in the West African country, despite allegations of repression for opposition parties.

events.title: Berlin: Archaeologists on a treasure hunt in the capital
events.description: As traces of the Middle Ages are uncovered in the heart of Berlin, a new museum — PETRI Berlin — has been founded to house these discoveries.

events.title: Police arrest suspect after man stabs three women on Paris metro
events.description: French police on Friday (December 26) arrested a man suspected of stabbing three women in the Paris metro as the capital's end-of-year festivities were in full swing.

events.title: Three women stabbed in Paris metro stations
events.description: Three women have been stabbed in Paris, according to the capital's prosecutor's office.

events.title: Israel becomes first country to recognize Somaliland; Trump 'not ready'
events.description: Israel became the first country to officially recognize Somaliland as an independent nation in a historic diplomatic move tied to the Abraham Accords framework.

events.title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes
events.description: Almost one million people were displaced when hostilities resumed earlier this month after the first truce broke.

events.title: New York blanketed in snowfall, sparking travel chaos
events.description: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled and more than 3,000 were delayed by the winter storm.

events.title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire starts, first 72 hours seen as critical test
events.description: A ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia has come into effect after weeks of deadly fighting across the border.

events.title: UN renews Sudan ceasefire appeal over ‘unimaginable suffering’ of civilians
events.description: Secretary-General Antonio Guterres appeals for immediate truce as fighting intensifies in Darfur and Kordofan regions.

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree on ceasefire to end weeks of deadly fighting
events.description: Agreement follows talks aimed at ending weeks of deadly clashes along the Thailand-Cambodia border.

events.title: Japan’s cabinet approves record defence budget amid escalating China tensions
events.description: Japanese strike-back capabilities and coastal defences to be boosted while Beijing accuses Tokyo of fuelling a ‘space arms race’ Japan’s cabinet has approved a record high defence budget as tensions with China continue to spiral, with Beijing this week accusing Tokyo of “fuelling a space arms race”. The draft defence budget for the next fiscal year – approved on Friday – is more than ¥9tn ($58bn) and 9.4% bigger than the previous budget, which will end in April. The increase comes in the fourth year of Japan’s five-year program to double its annual arms spending to 2% of GDP. Continue reading...

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign new ceasefire agreement to end border fighting
events.description: In addition to ending fighting, the agreement calls for no further military movements by either side and no violations of either side's airspace for military purposes.

events.title: Achraf Hakimi and football's growing issue: playing time
events.description: According to a new FIFPRO report, Morocco and Paris Saint-Germain star Achraf Hakimi is a footballer at his limit, having had a season that lasted nearly a whole year. After an injury, he is now at AFCON with Morocco.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Russia pummels Kyiv, Zelenskyy heads to US
events.description: Russia launched missile and drone strikes on Kyiv and other Ukrainian regions, ahead of President Volodmyr Zelenskyy's key meeting with US President Trump. Follow DW for more.

events.title: Argentina: Congress passes first budget under Milei
events.description: After two years in office, the libertarian leader's budget was approved by Congress. Despite triggering protests, Milei has stuck to his controversial austerity measures.

events.title: Thailand, Cambodia agree to 'immediate' ceasefire
events.description: Tensions reignited between the two neighbors earlier this month, claiming dozens of lives.

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire agreement after weeks of intense fighting
events.description: Thailand and Cambodia have signed a ceasefire agreement to end weeks of armed combat along their border over competing claims to territory.

events.title: Trump launches Christmas night airstrikes in Nigeria and more top headlines

events.title: Nigeria says it shared intelligence to support US strikes on ISIS
events.description: Nigeria confirmed it shared intelligence with the U.S. ahead of Christmas night airstrikes against ISIS targets accused of killing Christians.

events.title: Israel recognises Somaliland as independent state, Netanyahu says
events.description: The decision has been condemned by Somalia, Egypt, Turkey and Djibouti, who call it a dangerous precedent.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: How the U.S. has changed its approach to foreign aid this year
events.description: This year saw the dismantling of USAID, the United States' premier aid agency. What was the impact and what does the future of U.S. foreign aid look like in the health realm?

events.title: DR Congo: Displaced people in South Kivu close to ‘utter desperation’, WFP says
events.description: An estimated 500,000 people have been forced from their homes since fighting erupted in South Kivu province, Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), at the beginning of December.

events.title: WATCH: Video shows suspect push trooper to ground before stealing patrol cruiser on Christmas Day
events.description: Dramatic video shows a suspect allegedly pulling a Washington trooper from a car on Christmas Day and stealing a cruiser on a Seattle interstate before his arrest.

events.title: Russian forces near collapse in Kupyansk as Moscow allies concede city lost: report
events.description: Russian forces were reportedly cut off and surrendering in Ukraine's Kupyansk as supply lines fail. Only dozens of isolated troops remain in the strategic city.

events.title: India's solar boom faces a hidden waste problem
events.description: A recent study has found that India will generate over 11 million tonnes of solar waste by 2047 if it does not scale up recycling.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Brazilian judge puts coup plot convicts under house arrest after former police commander flees
events.description: A Brazilian judge has issued house arrest orders for 10 people involved in a plot to keep former President Jair Bolsonaro in power after his 2022 election loss

events.title: Former Florida law enforcement officer accused of forcing 6-year-old underwater in hotel pool: report
events.description: Former law enforcement officer Tiffany Lee Griffith has been charged with aggravated child abuse after allegedly holding a 6-year-old underwater at a Florida hotel.

events.title: Christmas returns to Holy Land cities as Bethlehem’s Christian population dwindles, Nazareth remains strong
events.description: Christmas returns to Bethlehem amid ongoing concerns over Christian population decline from 86% in 1950 to just 10% today, while Nazareth enjoys growth.

events.description: Incursion follows Israeli defence minister's order for military to 'act forcefully' against the Palestinian town.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?

events.description: The leaders of Guinea and the Central African Republic aim to consolidate power after Sunday's polls.

events.title: A year on, Israel still holds Gaza doctor Hussam Abu Safia without charge
events.description: Abu Safia's health has deteriorated considerably since he was taken by Israeli soldiers.

events.description: Ex-Brazilian police chief caught using fake Paraguay passport in attempt to board flight to Panama, sent back to Brazil.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news

events.title: Opposition anger as Guinea’s junta leader is frontrunner to be elected president
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya accused of betraying his promise to be the restorer of democracy after leading 2021 coup In September 2021, a tall, young colonel in the Guinean army announced that he and his comrades had forcibly seized power and toppled the longtime leader Alpha Condé. “The will of the strongest has always supplanted the law,” Mamady Doumbouya said in a speech, stressing that the soldiers were acting to restore the will of the people. Continue reading...

events.title: British-Egyptian activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah arrives in UK after travel ban lifted
events.description: Family say campaigner, who has a son in Brighton, will be able to travel freely between UK and Cairo months after his release from Egyptian jail The British-Egyptian dissident Alaa Abd el-Fattah has arrived in London after the Egyptian government lifted a travel ban that it had imposed on him despite releasing him from jail in September . Abd el-Fattah had been held in jail nearly continuously for 10 years, mainly due to expressing his opposition to the treatment of dissidents by the Egyptian government. He had been detained in jail two years beyond his five-year sentence as the Cairo authorities refused to recognise the period he held in pre-trial detention as part of his time served. Continue reading...

events.title: China imposes sanctions on US defence firms over Taiwan arms deal
events.description: $10bn Trump-approved sale to Taipei triggers Beijing sanctions against firms such as Boeing and Northrop Grumman China’s foreign ministry has hit US defence companies including Boeing with sanctions after Donald Trump approved a large package of arms sales to Taiwan. The ministry said on Friday that the measures – against 10 individuals and 20 US firms including Boeing’s production hub at St Louis in Missouri – would freeze any assets the companies and individuals hold in China and bar domestic organisations and individuals from doing business with them. Continue reading...

events.title: Myanmar is holding its first elections in five years
events.description: Myanmar's is holding its first elections since the military seized power five years ago. It could give the military junta more legitimacy.

events.title: Louvre installs bars over gallery windows in latest security measure post-heist
events.description: France's Louvre museum has installed large metal bars over the windows of the gallery thieves broke into in October.

events.title: Germany: Drones disrupt air traffic in Hanover
events.description: Several flights were diverted after at least five drones were spotted near an airport in northern Germany.

events.title: Fax and furious: Why Germany struggles to go digital
events.description: Germany, the land of tech pioneers, still relies on fax and paper for basic public services. Why is digital government stuck in the slow lane while Denmark and India race ahead?

events.title: Trump-Zelenkskyy meeting: What you need to know
events.description: The Ukrainian and US leaders are set to meet in Florida as Washington continues to push its peace proposal. An "economic agreement" between the two countries is also on the table.

events.title: Malaysia: Ex-PM Najib sentenced to 15 years on new charges
events.description: Former prime minister Najib Razak had already been convicted for graft and money laundering linked to the 1MDB investment fund. The latest verdict, however, is likely to rock Malaysia's ruling coalition to the core.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Senegal and DR Congo to target second win
events.description: Senegal will take on the Democratic Republic of Congo in Group D on Saturday (December 26) in Tanger. FRANCE 24's Selina Sykes tells us more from Tangier.

events.title: Ukraine's anti-corruption agency attempts raid of parliament in new graft probe
events.description: Ukraine’s anti-corruption agency said on Saturday that security services were blocking its attempt to raid parliament, as investigators alleged that sitting MPs were implicated in a new graft probe. The probe comes at a delicate time for President Volodymyr Zelensky, as he seeks better terms for Ukraine in US-brokered peace talks.

events.title: 2025 AFCON jerseys:  ‘An opportunity to bring some light' on brands' work
events.description: As with every tournament- the Africa Cup of Nations is also notable for the uniforms worn by the players of the different nations - whose jerseys celebrate the diversity of cultures. For more on this, FRANCE 24’s Catherine Viette is joined by Matthieu Morge Zucconi - fashion editor at Le Figaro newspaper.

events.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak sentenced to 15 more years in landmark corruption case
events.description: A Malaysian judge sentenced former prime minister Najib Razak to 15 more years in jail on Friday (December 26) after convicting him of abuse of power and money laundering in a sovereign wealth fund graft scandal.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Morocco forced to wait for knockout place after Mali draw
events.description: Morocco missed the chance to guarantee their spot in the last 16 of the Africa Cup of Nations after Lassine Sinayoko's second-half penalty earned Mali a 1-1 draw with the hosts on Friday (December 26). FRANCE 24's Selina Sykes tells us more.

events.title: Man is told Himmler was his grandad - this is how he felt
events.description: "Evil monster, murderer, Nazi," - that's how Henrik Lenkeit describes his grandfather.

events.title: Clinton told to avoid public handshake with Gerry Adams, records show
events.description: White House officials wanted Bill Clinton to avoid shaking Sinn Fein leader Gerry Adams' hand in front of cameras during his historic visit to Ireland in 1995, newly released records show.

events.title: British-Egyptian activist returns to the UK and reunites with family after prison release
events.description: British-Egyptian pro-democracy activist Alaa Abd El-Fattah has returned to the UK for the first time since his release after spending six years in prison in Egypt.

events.title: South Korea vows to end foreign adoptions as UN presses Seoul to address past abuses
events.description: South Korea’s government says it plans to end the waning foreign adoptions of Korean children

events.title: GLIMPSES: Prepping polling machines ahead of Myanmar's weekend election
events.description: Before the polls comes the preparation

events.title: Myanmar will hold its first general election in 5 years as criticism of the military rule mounts
events.description: Myanmar will hold the first phase of a general election on Sunday, its first vote in five years and an election framed by the ruling military as a return to multi-party democracy

events.title: Japan's Cabinet OKs record defense budget that aims to deter China
events.description: Japan’s Cabinet has approved a record defense budget plan exceeding 9 trillion yen for the coming year

events.title: Korean prosecutors seek 10-year sentence for ousted President Yoon in first martial law trial
events.description: An independent counsel has demanded a 10-year prison term for South Korea’s ousted President Yoon Suk Yeol

events.title: Gaza: Humanitarian response ongoing despite restrictions
events.description: Although “significant restrictions and impediments” continue to hamper humanitarian operations in Gaza, teams are still responding to the population’s needs, the UN aid coordination office OCHA said on Wednesday.

events.title: UN celebrates 10 years of progress in youth, peace and security agenda
events.description: The UN has long been at the forefront of efforts to involve young people in decision-making, and the last decade has seen significant progress, thanks to the adoption of a Security Council resolution on youth, peace and security which led to widespread changes in the ways that the voices of young people are not just heard, but also incorporated in peace plans and policies.

events.title: Defiant TPUSA leader won't quit despite chapter facing harassment, hostility after Kirk assassination
events.description: Northern Arizona University Turning Point USA leader Rose Lombardo is standing strong despite backlash for her right-wing activism.

events.title: Florida man allegedly steals 400 pounds of avocados to buy Christmas presents for children
events.description: A Florida man was arrested after he allegedly trespassed in an avocado grove and stole roughly 400 pounds of the fruit in order to sell them for money to buy Christmas gifts.

events.title: Nude burglar arrested on Christmas night after allegedly breaking into two luxury Florida homes
events.description: A nude man allegedly broke into two luxury Golden Beach homes Christmas night and was found hiding in the garage of a $12 million home after drinking.

events.title: Trump reveals potential Kennedy Center marble armrests 'unlike anything ever done or seen before'
events.description: President Donald Trump posted images of new marble armrests for the renamed Kennedy Center as an ongoing lawsuit continues to challenge the rebrand decision.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: JonBenet Ramsey case, Scott Peterson's bid, Kimberlee Singler returns
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: JonBenet Ramsey case could benefit from new DNA technology as police renew commitment
events.description: Boulder police renew efforts in JonBenet Ramsey murder case with new chief praising advanced DNA testing, nearly 30 years after the Christmas tragedy that shocked America.

events.title: President of TPUSA chapter twice denied by university's student government vows to fight: 'not backing down'
events.description: Loyola University student fights for conservative club after being denied twice. Anistin Murray vows to keep battling for Turning Point USA chapter.

events.title: Santa with CCW gets pulled over, tells Ohio deputy 'you got to protect yourself' during festive traffic stop
events.description: Santa was pulled over for speeding in Ohio and told a deputy he had a concealed carry permit. Hilarious bodycam footage shows Christmas magic meeting reality.

events.title: Trio of Palestinians arrested for allegedly torching Christmas tree at Catholic church in West Bank
events.description: Three Palestinians accused of torching a Christmas tree and damaging part of a Nativity scene at a West Bank Catholic church were arrested.

events.title: Zelenskyy encouraged by 'very good' Christmas talks with US
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy expresses optimism about Ukraine peace talks after Christmas conversation with U.S. envoys, as negotiations show progress.

events.title: Poland scrambles jets on Christmas after detecting Russian reconnaissance aircraft near its airspace
events.description: Poland scrambled fighter jets on Christmas morning after detecting a Russian reconnaissance aircraft near its airspace over the Baltic Sea.

events.title: Trump-backed candidate Asfura wins Honduras presidential election
events.description: Tito Asfura secured Honduras' presidency, defeating Salvador Nasralla and Rixi Ramona Moncada Godoy in a polarized campaign that shifts Central America's political landscape.
